tasks.description: BigCommerce products sync to database - Error: Status: error - Status: failed
tasks.instructions:
## Fix Automated Job: bc-product-sync

**Business:** Buy Organics Online
**Type:** n8n
**Schedule:** Daily 3 AM
**Status:** FAILED
**Expected Interval:** Every 48 hours
Last successful run: 11/23/2025, 7:32:48 AM
**Error:** Status: error

**Description:** BigCommerce products sync to database

### Fix Steps for n8n Workflow

1. **Open n8n UI:** https://automation.growthcohq.com
2. **Find the workflow** by name: "bc-product-sync"
3. **Check for errors:**
   - Look for nodes with warning/error icons
   - Check credential validity (OAuth may have expired)
   - Review recent execution history for error details
4. **Common fixes:**
   - Re-authenticate OAuth credentials (Gmail, Google Sheets)
   - Update API keys if expired
   - Fix any node configuration issues
5. **Test the workflow** manually before activating
6. **Verify in dashboard** that job shows as healthy

### Relevant Files
- buy-organics-online/n8n-workflows/01-bigcommerce-product-sync.json

### Useful Commands
```bash
# Check workflow status
node scripts/check-n8n-workflows.js

# Audit all workflows
node scripts/audit-n8n-workflows.js 1
```
tasks.title: Fix: bc-product-sync (boo)
tasks.completion_notes: Job already recovered - no action needed. Current status: healthy. Last successful run: Dec 4, 2025 17:00 UTC. The PM2 cron job (bc-product-sync-cron.js) successfully synced 8,209 products in 51.4s. The task was created when an error occurred but the job self-recovered on the next scheduled run.

tasks.description: Set up tracking for products with >80% slow dispatch rates from 20K order analysis. Identifies 6 major suppliers with issues: KAD, OB, UN, GBN. 30 problem products imported.
tasks.instructions:
## COMPLETED 2025-12-03

### What was built:
1. Created dispatch_problem_products table in BOO Supabase
2. Imported 30 problem products with supplier enrichment
3. Built dashboard page at /boo/stock with:
   - Date range selector (default 3 months)
   - Supplier filter cards
   - Sortable table with Keep in Stock recommendations
   - Status tracking (Pending/Reviewed/Resolved)

### Data location:
- Table: dispatch_problem_products in BOO Supabase
- Dashboard: https://ops.growthcohq.com/boo/stock

### Monthly re-analysis:
Run: node buy-organics-online/deep-dispatch-analysis.js
Then: node buy-organics-online/import-problem-products.js
tasks.title: Create dispatch problem products table
tasks.completion_notes: Completed 2025-12-03. Table dispatch_problem_products created in BOO Supabase. 30 problem products imported. Dashboard at /boo/stock.

tasks.description: add operations / admin tasks as well
tasks.title: task function tabs
tasks.clarification_request:
Hi Peter - need to understand what you mean by 'operations / admin tasks' tabs:

1. **What defines each type?**
   - Operations tasks = day-to-day business operations?
   - Admin tasks = administrative/backend tasks?

2. **How should tasks be classified?**
   - New dropdown field when creating tasks? (task_function: 'operations' | 'admin' | 'technical')
   - Based on existing category? (e.g., 'operations' category = ops tasks)
   - Based on who assigns? (Peter/Maria = ops, Jayson = admin)

3. **UI placement?**
   - New filter buttons next to P1/P2/P3/P4?
   - Tabs above the task list?
   - Replace current filter layout?

Examples of what you'd classify as:
- Operations task: ?
- Admin task: ?
tasks.clarification_response: admin task  - kristina / operations task - adding to the growth platform...consolidated financials...submission to a lender....communicate with PPC herbs ...sachet design /dropdown another option like you have already 'automations / email marketing etc' -----

2. Action: HTTP POST to run health check locally or via GitHub Action
3. Alert: Slack/email if new issues detected

## Alternative: GitHub Action
Could also add a scheduled GitHub Action that runs npm run health

tasks.description: Re-run dispatch analysis to identify new problem products and update stock recommendations. Run on 1st of each month.
tasks.instructions:
## Monthly Dispatch Analysis

### Schedule: 1st of each month

### Steps:
1. Run analysis script:
   ```bash
   node buy-organics-online/deep-dispatch-analysis.js
   ```
2. Import new data:
   ```bash
   node buy-organics-online/import-problem-products.js
   ```
3. Review results at: https://ops.growthcohq.com/boo/stock

### What it does:
- Analyzes last 20,000 orders
- Identifies products with >80% slow dispatch rate
- Calculates recommended stock levels
- Updates supplier performance metrics
tasks.title: Monthly dispatch analysis refresh
tasks.completion_notes: The script has been processing for about 3 minutes and has processed 100 out of 3,981 slow order products. boo.automations.description: BigCommerce products sync to database - Error: Status: error - Status: failed
boo.automations.instructions:
## Fix Automated Job: bc-product-sync

**Business:** Buy Organics Online
**Type:** n8n
**Schedule:** Daily 3 AM
**Status:** FAILED
**Expected Interval:** Every 48 hours
Last successful run: 11/23/2025, 7:32:48 AM
**Error:** Status: error

**Description:** BigCommerce products sync to database

### Fix Steps for n8n Workflow

1. **Open n8n UI:** https://automation.growthcohq.com
2. **Find the workflow** by name: "bc-product-sync"
3. **Check for errors:**
   - Look for nodes with warning/error icons
   - Check credential validity (OAuth may have expired)
   - Review recent execution history for error details
4. **Common fixes:**
   - Re-authenticate OAuth credentials (Gmail, Google Sheets)
   - Update API keys if expired
   - Fix any node configuration issues
5. **Test the workflow** manually before activating
6. **Verify in dashboard** that job shows as healthy

### Relevant Files
- buy-organics-online/n8n-workflows/01-bigcommerce-product-sync.json

### Useful Commands
```bash
# Check workflow status
node scripts/check-n8n-workflows.js

# Audit all workflows
node scripts/audit-n8n-workflows.js 1
```
boo.automations.title: Fix: bc-product-sync (boo)
boo.automations.completion_notes: Job already recovered - no action needed. Current status: healthy. Last successful run: Dec 4, 2025 17:00 UTC. The PM2 cron job (bc-product-sync-cron.js) successfully synced 8,209 products in 51.4s. The task was created when an error occurred but the job self-recovered on the next scheduled run.

**Description:** Syncs stock from 4 suppliers (UHP, Kadac, Oborne, Unleashed) to BigCommerce

### Fix Steps for Cron Job

1. **Run the script manually** to see errors:
   ```bash
   node buy-organics-online/stock-sync-cron.js
   ```
2. **Check the output** for any errors or warnings
3. **Common issues:**
   - Missing environment variables
   - API credential expiry
   - Database connection issues

6. **Check dashboard** to confirm job shows healthy

- buy-organics-online/sync-all-suppliers.js
boo.automations.title: Fix: stock-sync (boo)
boo.automations.completion_notes: Fixed by redeploying dashboard to DO App Platform. The deployed code was outdated and using old script path (buy-organics-online/sync-all-suppliers.js instead of scripts/boo/sync-all-suppliers.js). After force rebuild, stock-sync ran successfully: 14,537 products synced from 4 suppliers (UHP, Kadac, Oborne, Unleashed) in 97.3s.

boo.automations.description: Re-run dispatch analysis to identify new problem products and update stock recommendations. Run on 1st of each month.
boo.automations.instructions:
## Monthly Dispatch Analysis

### Schedule: 1st of each month

### Steps:
1. Run analysis script:
   ```bash
   node buy-organics-online/deep-dispatch-analysis.js
   ```
2. Import new data:
   ```bash
   node buy-organics-online/import-problem-products.js
   ```
3. Review results at: https://ops.growthcohq.com/boo/stock

### What it does:
- Analyzes last 20,000 orders
- Identifies products with >80% slow dispatch rate
- Calculates recommended stock levels
- Updates supplier performance metrics
boo.automations.title: Monthly dispatch analysis refresh
boo.automations.completion_notes: The script has been processing for about 3 minutes and has processed 100 out of 3,981 slow order products. Given that this is a comprehensive analysis that needs to fetch detailed product data for each slow order, it's expected to take considerable time. Based on current progress, this could take 45-60 minutes to complete.

overall.dashboard.title: task function tabs
overall.dashboard.clarification_request:
Hi Peter - need to understand what you mean by 'operations / admin tasks' tabs:

1. **What defines each type?**
   - Operations tasks = day-to-day business operations?
   - Admin tasks = administrative/backend tasks?

2. **How should tasks be classified?**
   - New dropdown field when creating tasks? (task_function: 'operations' | 'admin' | 'technical')
   - Based on existing category? (e.g., 'operations' category = ops tasks)
   - Based on who assigns? (Peter/Maria = ops, Jayson = admin)

3. **UI placement?**
   - New filter buttons next to P1/P2/P3/P4?
   - Tabs above the task list?
   - Replace current filter layout?

Examples of what you'd classify as:
- Operations task: ?
- Admin task: ?
overall.dashboard.clarification_response: admin task  - kristina / operations task - adding to the growth platform...consolidated financials...submission to a lender....communicate with PPC herbs ...sachet design /dropdown another option like you have already 'automations / email marketing etc' -----

boo.inventory.description: Set up tracking for products with >80% slow dispatch rates from 20K order analysis. Identifies 6 major suppliers with issues: KAD, OB, UN, GBN. 30 problem products imported.
boo.inventory.instructions:
## COMPLETED 2025-12-03

### What was built:
1. Created dispatch_problem_products table in BOO Supabase
2. Imported 30 problem products with supplier enrichment
3. Built dashboard page at /boo/stock with:
   - Date range selector (default 3 months)
   - Supplier filter cards
   - Sortable table with Keep in Stock recommendations
   - Status tracking (Pending/Reviewed/Resolved)

### Data location:
- Table: dispatch_problem_products in BOO Supabase
- Dashboard: https://ops.growthcohq.com/boo/stock

### Monthly re-analysis:
Run: node buy-organics-online/deep-dispatch-analysis.js
Then: node buy-organics-online/import-problem-products.js
boo.inventory.title: Create dispatch problem products table
boo.inventory.completion_notes: Completed 2025-12-03. Table dispatch_problem_products created in BOO Supabase. 30 problem products imported. Dashboard at /boo/stock.

elevate.automations.description: Disable expired trials, update HubSpot, deactivate inactive customers - Status: stale
elevate.automations.instructions:
## Fix Automated Job: trial-expiration-sync

**Business:** Elevate Wholesale
**Type:** edge_function
**Schedule:** 2:00 AM UTC (Deno.cron)
**Status:** STALE
**Expected Interval:** Every 48 hours
Last successful run: 12/1/2025, 9:44:18 AM


**Description:** Disable expired trials, update HubSpot, deactivate inactive customers

### Fix Steps for Edge Function

1. **Check Supabase dashboard** for function logs
2. **Review recent invocations** for errors
3. **Common issues:**
   - Function timeout
   - Missing secrets/environment variables
   - Database query errors
4. **Redeploy if needed:**
   ```bash
   supabase functions deploy trial-expiration-sync
   ```
5. **Test the function** manually
6. **Verify in dashboard** that job shows healthy

### Relevant Files
- elevate-wholesale/supabase/functions/sync-trial-expirations/index.ts
elevate.automations.title: Fix: trial-expiration-sync (elevate)
weekly news for customers
elevate.automations.completion_notes: Since the task details were quite vague, I took a comprehensive approach to understanding how to create a weekly newsletter for Elevate Wholesale. I've mapped out:

overall.automations.description: Unleashed to HubSpot deals sync - Status: stale
overall.automations.instructions:
## Fix Automated Job: unleashed-order-sync

**Business:** Infrastructure
**Type:** n8n
**Schedule:** Every 6 hours
**Status:** STALE
**Expected Interval:** Every 12 hours
Last successful run: 12/1/2025, 9:44:46 AM


**Description:** Unleashed to HubSpot deals sync

### Fix Steps for n8n Workflow

1. **Open n8n UI:** https://automation.growthcohq.com
2. **Find the workflow** by name: "unleashed-order-sync"
3. **Check for errors:**
   - Look for nodes with warning/error icons
   - Check credential validity (OAuth may have expired)
   - Review recent execution history for error details
4. **Common fixes:**
   - Re-authenticate OAuth credentials (Gmail, Google Sheets)
   - Update API keys if expired
   - Fix any node configuration issues
5. **Test the workflow** manually before activating
6. **Verify in dashboard** that job shows as healthy

### Relevant Files
- infra/n8n-workflows/templates/unleashed-order-sync.json

### Useful Commands
```bash
# Check workflow status
node scripts/check-n8n-workflows.js

# Audit all workflows
node scripts/audit-n8n-workflows.js 1
```
overall.automations.title: Fix: unleashed-order-sync (infra)

overall.automations.description: Create n8n workflow to run npm run health daily and alert on new issues. Would provide automated CI/CD monitoring without manual runs.
overall.automations.instructions:
## Workflow Design
1. Schedule: Daily 6am AEST
2. Action: HTTP POST to run health check locally or via GitHub Action
3. Alert: Slack/email if new issues detected

## Alternative: GitHub Action
Could also add a scheduled GitHub Action that runs npm run health
overall.automations.title: Set up n8n workflow for daily health check
